did.head: Descriptive Summary

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: Retired Chief of the Gastrointestinal Clinic at Mount Sinai Hospital.

Collection consists of medical and pharmaceutical advertisements and promotional materials. Included are posters, booklets, and promotional emphemera. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Advertising, Sales & Marketing History.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Collection of Albert Cornell, M.D., David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Collection of Albert Cornell, M.D. were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 2006.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection is minimally processed: materials may not have been ordered and described beyond their original condition.
Descriptive sources and standards used to create this inventory: DACS, EAD, NCEAD guidelines, and our local Style Guide.
This finding aid is NCEAD compliant.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Dr. Cornell was a consultant in gastroenterology at the Mount Sinai Medical Center and the retired Chief of the Gastrointestinal Clinic at Mount Sinai Hospital.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection consists of medical and pharmaceutical advertisements and promotional materials. Included are posters, booklets, and promotional emphemera. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Advertising, Sales & Marketing History.

controlaccess.head: Subject Headings
controlaccess.p: These are searchable subject entries for this collection. Performing a search on these subjects in the Duke University Libraries online catalog will bring up other related research materials.

item.corpname: John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History

scopecontent.p: Collection consists of medical and pharmaceutical advertisements. primarily posters, booklets and ephemera. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Advertising, Sales & Marketing History.

did.unittitle: Collateral literature and advertising materials from pharmaceutical and other medical companies, 1950s-1960s
Pharmaceutical and other medical advertising materials

scopecontent.p: Rulers, pens, nail clippers, and other household items.
Golf balls, pens, drug trays, a large nut and bolt, and other promotional materials.
Trays, mugs, cups, and other materials.

processinfo.p: [Some papers are fragile. Technical services staff may need to make use copies prior to researcher use.]
